question.content:
$\begin{align}
&-x-3y=9
\\\\
&6x-6y=-6
\end{align}$

**Graph the system of equations.**

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

**What is the solution?**

$x= $  [[☃ numeric-input 1]]

$y= $  [[☃ numeric-input 2]]

hints.content:
Let's find the intercepts of the line given by first equation:

$\qquad$Substitute $\blue x=\blue 0\qquad$ | Substitute $\pink y=\pink 0\qquad$ 
:-: | :-:
$\begin{align}-\blue x-3y&=9\\\\-\blue 0-3y&=9\\\\-3y&=9\\\\y&=-3\end{align}$ | $\begin{align}-x-3\pink y&=9\\\\-x-3\cdot\pink 0&=9\\\\-x&=9\\\\x&=-9\end{align}$

So the $y$-intercept of the line given by the first equation is $(0,-3)$ and its $x$-intercept is $(-9,0)$.

In a similar manner, we will find that the $y$-intercept of the line given by the second equation is $(0,1)$, and its $x$-intercept is $(-1,0)$.

Now we can graph the lines!

When we graph the two lines, we can see that they intersect at $(-3,-2)$. Therefore, this is the solution of the system:

$\begin{align}
&x=-3
\\\\
&y=-2
\end{align}$
